findings.title: ST - Stops Transactions
findings.description: The transactions are initially disabled for all users excluding authorized addresses. The owner can enable transactions for all users but cannot disable them again. Additionally, the contract owner has authority to stop sales for all users excluding the owner.

findings.title: UPA - Unexcluded Pinksale Address
findings.description: The contract's fee mechanism poses an obstacle for integration with platforms like Pinksale, specifically preventing the creation of a launchpad on Pinksale without exempting the Pinksale factory address from transaction fees.

findings.title: CR - Code Repetition
findings.description: The contract contains repetitive code segments which can lead to issues like gas efficiency, complexity, readability, security, and maintainability of the source code.

findings.title: DDP - Decimal Division Precision
findings.description: Division of decimal (fixed point) numbers can result in rounding errors due to the way that division is implemented in Solidity.

findings.title: EPC - Existing Pair Creation
findings.description: The contract contains a function that does not handle the scenario where a pair already exists prior to its execution.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards. The `immutable` declaration can save gas when it is defined.

findings.title: MEM - Misleading Error Messages
findings.description: The contract is using misleading error messages which do not accurately reflect the problem, making it difficult to identify and fix the issue.

findings.title: PTRP - Potential Transfer Revert Propagation
findings.description: The contract sends funds to a `marketingFeeReceiver` as part of the transfer flow. If the address belongs to a contract then it may revert from incoming payment, causing the error to propagate to the token’s contract and revert the transfer.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but the price of the token can be highly volatile, potentially leading to significant price volatility for parties involved.

findings.title: RED - Redudant Event Declaration
findings.description: The event `AutoLiquify` is declared and not being used in the contract.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of the SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions 0.8.0 and above have native functionality for arithmetic operations that revert to underflow and overflow.

findings.title: L02 - State Variables could be Declared Constant
findings.description: State variables can be declared as constant using the constant keyword to ensure their values cannot be changed after being set, which decreases gas consumption of the corresponding transaction.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code, including naming conventions for functions, variables, contracts, structs, enums, and constants. Adhering to these conventions can improve the readability and maintainability of the code.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L16 - Validate Variable Setters
findings.description: The contract performs operations on variables configured by user-supplied input without proper checks for zero values, leading to potential problems during execution.
